name: hdr10plus_tool
description: CLI utility to work with HDR10+ in HEVC files

repo.name: hdr10plus_tool
repo.description: CLI utility to work with HDR10+ in HEVC files.

readme.summary: Well-structured documentation with excellent command examples and clear use cases, though installation could be more beginner-friendly.
readme.top_issue: Installation section assumes familiarity with Rust toolchain and doesn't provide step-by-step build instructions for users unfamiliar with Cargo.

injection_risks.description: The code uses the `anyhow` crate, which can potentially lead to error messages exposing internal details. However, this is not a significant risk in this case.
The code uses the `bail!` macro from the `anyhow` crate, which can potentially lead to error messages exposing internal details. However, this is not a significant risk in this case.

security.summary: The code has some minor security concerns related to error handling and input validation, but overall it appears to be well-structured and secure.

common_complaints: Editor command fails with multiple frame ranges or non-descending order
Frame count mismatches and extraction failures on certain files
Limited container format support (MP4 not supported, only MKV)
HDR10+ metadata validation and injection issues
praise_themes: Tool functionality is appreciated and actively used
Feature requests indicate users value the project
Technical implementation quality seems solid for supported use cases
sentiment.summary: Active but niche project with moderate maintainer engagement; users encounter real bugs with metadata editing and frame handling, yet feature requests (AV1, scene export) suggest ongoing community interest despite frustration with undocumented constraints.

red_flags: repeatedly asks for more details without providing solutions
occasional hostility towards users who don't provide enough information
communication.summary: The maintainer provides useful technical insights but could be more patient and welcoming, especially with new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite recent repository activity
No closed issues in past 6 months indicating lack of maintenance
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing no active development
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date indicates poor release management
positive_signals: Repository has recent activity (last commit Jan 8, 2026)
maintenance.summary: This package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite the repository existing.

project_metrics.description: CLI utility to work with HDR10+ in HEVC files.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is detailed and provides many examples, but lacks clear installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Docs: Installation instructions are incomplete and do not provide a straightforward way to install the package using homebrew.
Communication: repeatedly asks for more details without providing solutions
Communication: occasional hostility towards users who don't provide enough information
High bus factor risk (98% from top contributor)
highlights: Recent commits and releases in the past month
Multiple contributors have been active in the last six months
